page.title: 02INTRODUCTION (CONTINUED)
page.content:
{ { Farming}is of major importance, early potatoes, tomatoes & flowers are all grown & dairy cattle are kept on many of the farms.
La Hougue Bie, a major{historical {site,}is situated in the middle of the square. It is a well preserved passage grave or dolmen from the Neolithic Period (c.3000 B.C.).
In the S.W. corner of the square is the{Education}Department from where the Island's schools are run.
The square is unusual for Jersey in that it has no coastline, but is typical of rural Jersey with its intensive dairying and market gardening.
